dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c & b Woakes 88 (98b 10x4 0x6 158m) SR: 89.79

dismissalComment.html: top catch! No hundred for Dilshan. It was a length delivery, a slower ball in off-cutter mode, Dilshan was aiming to work it into the leg side and gets a fat leading edge which loops back down the pitch, but on the on side, and Woakes dives across from his follow through to hold the catch one-handed

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera run out (Root/Bopara/†Buttler) 59 (74b 5x4 1x6 89m) SR: 79.72

dismissalComment.html: bit of a leg side heave from off stump but gets it wide of deep midwicket, chance for a second but there's a total mix up! And Perera is run out by miles. Disaster for Sri Lanka after such a good start. It appeared both batsman wanted the second, both set off strongly but then Dilshan suddenly stopped, Perera hesitated before deciding to carry on but the damage was done, Dilshan was going nowhere, retreated back into his ground leaving an easy lob from Bopara to Buttler for the run out. Whoops!

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: another one high, high into the air but this time Stokes is under it and that's a fine catch. Barely a foot in from the long-on boundary, Stokes down on his knees almost has held on very well to a mighty steepler from Mathews who went too big once too often, not timed again and this time not enough club to get away with it

this slips down the leg side, Jayawardene tickles at it and there's a big appeal for caught behind and given out! A second big wicket for England. This has come right off the face of the bat and Jos Buttler has pouched a very smart catch down the leg side

top catch! No hundred for Dilshan. It was a length delivery, a slower ball in off-cutter mode, Dilshan was aiming to work it into the leg side and gets a fat leading edge which loops back down the pitch, but on the on side, and Woakes dives across from his follow through to hold the catch one-handed

length on the off stump, driven up over the infield is it? Cook running back takes the catch diving away from him, splendid take and another wicket falls, England really pegging things back here. No timing on the stroke and not enough power either to clear Cook running back from extra cover

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera run out (Root/Bopara/†Buttler) 59 (74b 5x4 1x6 89m) SR: 79.72

dismissalComment.html: bit of a leg side heave from off stump but gets it wide of deep midwicket, chance for a second but there's a total mix up! And Perera is run out by miles. Disaster for Sri Lanka after such a good start. It appeared both batsman wanted the second, both set off strongly but then Dilshan suddenly stopped, Perera hesitated before deciding to carry on but the damage was done, Dilshan was going nowhere, retreated back into his ground leaving an easy lob from Bopara to Buttler for the run out. Whoops!

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara lbw b Ali 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: length ball, this turns off the straight and given out lbw! To the surprise of many and the batsman reviews after a quick chat with his partner. This gripped off middle and leg, turned to beat the outside edge and is going on to hit middle and off stump. Lovely delivery from Moeen, deceiving Sangakkara into aiming leg side, and a good decision from the umpire

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c & b Woakes 88 (98b 10x4 0x6 158m) SR: 89.79

It was a length delivery, a slower ball in off-cutter mode, Dilshan was aiming to work it into the leg side and gets a fat leading edge which loops back down the pitch, but on the on side, and Woakes dives across from his follow through to hold the catch one-handed

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Stokes b Tredwell 33 (24b 1x4 3x6 23m) SR: 137.5

dismissalComment.html: another one high, high into the air but this time Stokes is under it and that's a fine catch. Barely a foot in from the long-on boundary, Stokes down on his knees almost has held on very well to a mighty steepler from Mathews who went too big once too often, not timed again and this time not enough club to get away with it

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c †Buttler b Tredwell 55 (58b 5x4 0x6 88m) SR: 94.82

dismissalComment.html: this slips down the leg side, Jayawardene tickles at it and there's a big appeal for caught behind and given out! A second big wicket for England. This has come right off the face of the bat and Jos Buttler has pouched a very smart catch down the leg side

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Cook b Woakes 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: length on the off stump, driven up over the infield is it? Cook running back takes the catch diving away from him, splendid take and another wicket falls, England really pegging things back here. No timing on the stroke and not enough power either to clear Cook running back from extra cover

dismissalText.commentary: Moeen Ali c & b BMAJ Mendis 119 (87b 11x4 5x6 139m) SR: 136.78

dismissalComment.html: but now gone! Moeen propping forward and presenting a simple return catch for the bowler. Such a wonderful innings but this is a soft dismissal, too early on a little forward push and it's so easy for the bowler to take such an important wicket

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.long: c MDKJ Perera b NLTC Perera
dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara c MDKJ Perera b NLTC Perera 65 (62b 4x4 2x6 102m) SR: 104.83

dismissalComment.html: length ball, smashed high into the night, it has gone so far up, deep square comes in, Kusal Perera is the fielder, he's misjudged it slightly but dives forward and takes a blinder! A stunning catch to win the game. The ball hung up in the sky for an age and was exceptionally well held to end England's stubborn resistance

decent length just outside off, Bell gets a thickish outside edge and is taken at slip! Breakthrough for Sri Lanka. Bell playing defensively to a ball that might have just left him slightly and edging at waist height for an easy chance that's comfortably taken at slip
fuller length, Root driving at it and edging behind! Root's poor footwork the undoing of him once again. Pushed back, then drawn forward and he gets a feather edge to the keeper

length ball, smashed high into the night, it has gone so far up, deep square comes in, Kusal Perera is the fielder, he's misjudged it slightly but dives forward and takes a blinder! A stunning catch to win the game. The ball hung up in the sky for an age and was exceptionally well held to end England's stubborn resistance

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Morgan forward just outside off pushing towards the covers and gets an inside edge onto his stumps! England lose another and are now in a bit of trouble. A gentle prod forward slightly away from his body and Morgan has dragged this on
Tredwell backs away looking for a cut and gets bowled losing the top of his middle stump. The delivery skidded on quicker than Tredwell could attempt the cut stroke and he missed

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook lbw b Dilshan 10 (17b 0x4 0x6 32m) SR: 58.82

dismissalComment.html: this time he is gone! Not reviewing. Spin breaks the stand. Round the wicket, skids on with the arm, Cook looking to work to the leg side and is taken low down on the front pad

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c Jayawardene b NLTC Perera 35 (35b 3x4 0x6 36m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: decent length just outside off, Bell gets a thickish outside edge and is taken at slip! Breakthrough for Sri Lanka. Bell playing defensively to a ball that might have just left him slightly and edging at waist height for an easy chance that's comfortably taken at slip

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root c †Sangakkara b NLTC Perera 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: fuller length, Root driving at it and edging behind! Root's poor footwork the undoing of him once again. Pushed back, then drawn forward and he gets a feather edge to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan b BAW Mendis 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Morgan forward just outside off pushing towards the covers and gets an inside edge onto his stumps! England lose another and are now in a bit of trouble. A gentle prod forward slightly away from his body and Morgan has dragged this on

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler b Prasad 21 (21b 1x4 1x6 21m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: back on a decent length, Buttler props forward and gets an inside edge which bounces and then cannons leg stump! Very bad time for England to lose another wicket. Buttler was trying to sort of angle this away but it came back on him a little and the inside edge found the outside edge of leg stump

dismissalText.commentary: Moeen Ali c & b BMAJ Mendis 119 (87b 11x4 5x6 139m) SR: 136.78

dismissalComment.html: but now gone! Moeen propping forward and presenting a simple return catch for the bowler. Such a wonderful innings but this is a soft dismissal, too early on a little forward push and it's so easy for the bowler to take such an important wicket

headshotImage.caption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ben Stokes st †Sangakkara b Herath 16 (27b 0x4 0x6 28m) SR: 59.25

dismissalComment.html: that's pressure! He was find it hard to get the ball away, he was itching to come down the pitch, ends up yorking himself, plays over the ball and a neat take by Sangakkara

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Woakes st †Sangakkara b Herath 7 (11b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: tossed up, lures Woakes down the wicket, he's beaten and what a stumping! Herath deceived both batsman and keeper with a lovely flighted ball that pitched on middle and leg and turned across the off stump, Woakes played to leg, missed and fell out of his ground but then Sangakkara - who was headed down the leg side - darted his hands to his right to take the ball and whip off the bails, superb work behind the stumps, and a beauty of a delivery

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Tredwell b BAW Mendis 6 (11b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: Tredwell backs away looking for a cut and gets bowled losing the top of his middle stump. The delivery skidded on quicker than Tredwell could attempt the cut stroke and he missed

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.long: c MDKJ Perera b NLTC Perera
dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara c MDKJ Perera b NLTC Perera 65 (62b 4x4 2x6 102m) SR: 104.83

dismissalComment.html: length ball, smashed high into the night, it has gone so far up, deep square comes in, Kusal Perera is the fielder, he's misjudged it slightly but dives forward and takes a blinder! A stunning catch to win the game. The ball hung up in the sky for an age and was exceptionally well held to end England's stubborn resistance

dismissalText.long: c MDKJ Perera b NLTC Perera
dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara c MDKJ Perera b NLTC Perera 65 (62b 4x4 2x6 102m) SR: 104.83

commentPreTextItems.html: 26 in 18 balls, nervy stuff, Bopara can't make a wrong move now. Perera's final over coming up...

commentTextItems.html: length ball, smashed high into the night, it has gone so far up, deep square comes in, Kusal Perera is the fielder, he's misjudged it slightly but dives forward and takes a blinder! A stunning catch to win the game. The ball hung up in the sky for an age and was exceptionally well held to end England's stubborn resistance

commentPostTextItems.html: That's it for today where Sri Lanka have gone one-up in this seven-match series. But stick around for all the best analysis from Colombo. We stay put until Saturday, for the second ODI is on the same ground. It's a day game, so a 4.30am GMT start, see you then, bye for now...
Presentation coming up. The Man of the Match is Tillakaratne Dilshan for his 88, wicket of Alastair Cook and outstanding fielding.

Here's Alastair Cook: "The first 10 overs we didn't bowl as well as we should have done. We dragged it back nicely but in the last few we always tend to leek a few more than we'd like. Moeen played a blinder but we lost too many wickets which you can put down to lack of match practice. We know if you get behind the rate its difficult. Mo showed us the way. It's frustrating because we're not putting a whole game together. We thought 300 was a par score on that wicket and our wides have cost us but there's a lot of positive things from today with the way we attacked Sri Lanka."

Angelo Mathews: "It was a good game of cricket. We could tick all the boxes. The fielding was outstanding - we highlighted that after the India tour. We still can improve but I though our batting was brilliant. We got Kusal Perera back in form and Jeevan Mendis played really well too."

England will rue a poor bowling display for their latest ODI defeat. Their seamers in particular were rusty and sent down 17 wides. It was also curious how Bopara only bowled four overs despite his success. Sri Lanka feasted upon England's poor start with the ball - Thisara Perera showed how to bowl seam in these conditions - and put their troubles after the India tour behind them.

A cracking start to this series, Sri Lanka have won by 25 runs but were made to sweat firstly by Moeen Ali's scintillating hundred - his first in ODIs - and then by Ravi Bopara who fought bravely but was ultimately left with too much to do. Sri Lanka batted well themselves, led by Tillakaratne Dilshan's 88, in a strong total of 317 that's proved enough, but by a smaller margin than they might have expected.

commentTextItems.html: wide of off stump and Gurney is able to leave this alone

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: goes leg side again but without connection and after some consideration decides on a single
swept from off stump and he finds the gap at square leg, superb shot, timed it beautifully, it hovered just above the ground to take the slow outfield out of the equation
strong thump down the ground only straight on the bounce to long-off and Bopara refuses the run
wide of off stump, Gurney plays a lofted cover drive! Gets it in the gap and Bopara is back on strike

dismissalText.commentary: James Tredwell b BAW Mendis 6 (11b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 54.54

commentPreTextItems.html: Ajantha Mendis comes back, he's got a slip...

commentTextItems.html: Tredwell backs away looking for a cut and gets bowled losing the top of his middle stump. The delivery skidded on quicker than Tredwell could attempt the cut stroke and he missed

commentPostTextItems.html: Sri Lanka one wicket away now...

commentTextItems.html: length ball, dead-batted, Bopara wants to play tip and run but Tredwell says no with the ball having not moved far off the popping crease

commentPostTextItems.html: Still in the game England, what a match this is...

commentTextItems.html: oh dear! A beamer and Bopara managed to hoik it backward of square for four. Real bonus for England, a beamer at head height and Bopara hooked it literally off his grille. Very valuable that for England
gives himself room and aims over extra cover, gets its high but not that long, it plugs and they get back for the second
back and hit hard wide of long-on but the fielder does well going to his right and saves the boundary
slower ball, Bopara tried to get across his stumps to flick leg side but could only get struck on the thigh pad
length on off stump, blocked into the covers
full on leg stump, Tredwell forward and getting a thick inside edge through square leg
driven up in the air and just over extra cover, only a single so Tredwell again keeps the strike
back and cut but only as far as extra cover
flatter delivery, nudged out on the on side but just a single
floated up and Bopara heaves it over long-on, huge strike and that's his fifty, yet another lovely little cameo here
gives himself room aiming off side but can only find cover
floated up on leg stump, flicked through midwicket and Bopara is immediately back on strike

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c & b Woakes 88 (98b 10x4 0x6 158m) SR: 89.79

dismissalComment.html: another one high, high into the air but this time Stokes is under it and that's a fine catch. Barely a foot in from the long-on boundary, Stokes down on his knees almost has held on very well to a mighty steepler from Mathews who went too big once too often, not timed again and this time not enough club to get away with it

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c †Buttler b Tredwell 55 (58b 5x4 0x6 88m) SR: 94.82

dismissalComment.html: this slips down the leg side, Jayawardene tickles at it and there's a big appeal for caught behind and given out! A second big wicket for England. This has come right off the face of the bat and Jos Buttler has pouched a very smart catch down the leg side

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Cook b Woakes 4 (6b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: length on the off stump, driven up over the infield is it? Cook running back takes the catch diving away from him, splendid take and another wicket falls, England really pegging things back here. No timing on the stroke and not enough power either to clear Cook running back from extra cover

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook lbw b Dilshan 10 (17b 0x4 0x6 32m) SR: 58.82

dismissalComment.html: this time he is gone! Not reviewing. Spin breaks the stand. Round the wicket, skids on with the arm, Cook looking to work to the leg side and is taken low down on the front pad

dismissalText.commentary: Moeen Ali c & b BMAJ Mendis 119 (87b 11x4 5x6 139m) SR: 136.78

dismissalComment.html: but now gone! Moeen propping forward and presenting a simple return catch for the bowler. Such a wonderful innings but this is a soft dismissal, too early on a little forward push and it's so easy for the bowler to take such an important wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c Jayawardene b NLTC Perera 35 (35b 3x4 0x6 36m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: decent length just outside off, Bell gets a thickish outside edge and is taken at slip! Breakthrough for Sri Lanka. Bell playing defensively to a ball that might have just left him slightly and edging at waist height for an easy chance that's comfortably taken at slip

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root c †Sangakkara b NLTC Perera 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: fuller length, Root driving at it and edging behind! Root's poor footwork the undoing of him once again. Pushed back, then drawn forward and he gets a feather edge to the keeper

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan b BAW Mendis 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Morgan forward just outside off pushing towards the covers and gets an inside edge onto his stumps! England lose another and are now in a bit of trouble. A gentle prod forward slightly away from his body and Morgan has dragged this on

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler b Prasad 21 (21b 1x4 1x6 21m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: back on a decent length, Buttler props forward and gets an inside edge which bounces and then cannons leg stump! Very bad time for England to lose another wicket. Buttler was trying to sort of angle this away but it came back on him a little and the inside edge found the outside edge of leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.long: c MDKJ Perera b NLTC Perera
dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara c MDKJ Perera b NLTC Perera 65 (62b 4x4 2x6 102m) SR: 104.83

dismissalComment.html: length ball, smashed high into the night, it has gone so far up, deep square comes in, Kusal Perera is the fielder, he's misjudged it slightly but dives forward and takes a blinder! A stunning catch to win the game. The ball hung up in the sky for an age and was exceptionally well held to end England's stubborn resistance

headshotImage.caption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ben Stokes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ben Stokes st †Sangakkara b Herath 16 (27b 0x4 0x6 28m) SR: 59.25

dismissalComment.html: that's pressure! He was find it hard to get the ball away, he was itching to come down the pitch, ends up yorking himself, plays over the ball and a neat take by Sangakkara

dismissalText.commentary: Chris Woakes st †Sangakkara b Herath 7 (11b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: tossed up, lures Woakes down the wicket, he's beaten and what a stumping! Herath deceived both batsman and keeper with a lovely flighted ball that pitched on middle and leg and turned across the off stump, Woakes played to leg, missed and fell out of his ground but then Sangakkara - who was headed down the leg side - darted his hands to his right to take the ball and whip off the bails, superb work behind the stumps, and a beauty of a delivery

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: James Tredwell b BAW Mendis 6 (11b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 54.54

dismissalComment.html: Tredwell backs away looking for a cut and gets bowled losing the top of his middle stump. The delivery skidded on quicker than Tredwell could attempt the cut stroke and he missed

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Harry Gurney not out 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 50

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: back on a decent length, Buttler props forward and gets an inside edge which bounces and then cannons leg stump! Very bad time for England to lose another wicket. milestones.description: Ian Bell has scored 34 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for ENG breaking Pietersen's record

stories.title: England v Sri Lanka, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: England v Sri Lanka, 2014-15
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, England v Sri Lanka, 2014-15

stories.title: Dilshan, Thisara fined for Level 1 breaches
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Dilshan, Thisara fined for Level 1 breaches
stories.summary: Tillakaratne Dilshan has been fined 25 per cent of his match fee for excessive appealing during the first ODI against England, while Thisara Perera has been fined 20 per cent of his match fee for a separate incident

image.caption: Thisara Perera was pumped after removing Joe Root
image.longCaption: Thisara Perera was pumped after removing Joe Root, Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo, November 26, 2014

stories.title: Mighty Mo gives silver lining to cloud over Cook
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Mighty Moeen Ali gives silver lining to cloud over Alastair Cook
stories.summary: The mischievous thought that Moeen Ali and Alex Hales could feature in England's best ODI eleven will continue to grow as long as Alastair Cook's form remains in a muddy rut

image.caption: Alastair Cook was given out to consecutive balls but both times was saved on review
image.longCaption: Alastair Cook was given out to consecutive balls but both times was saved on review, Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo, November 26, 2014

stories.title: A tonic for Sri Lanka's top order
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: A tonic for Sri Lanka's top order
stories.summary: Though a strong argument remains that Mahela Jayawardene and Tillakaratne Dilshan are Sri Lanka's best opening pair, a consistent Kusal Perera is vital to the batsmen maintaining their present positions

image.caption: Kusal Perera overcame his lean series in India with a strong start
image.longCaption: Kusal Perera overcame his lean series in India with a strong start, Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo, November 26, 2014

stories.title: Sri Lanka hold on despite Moeen and Bopara
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Sri Lanka hold on despite Moeen Ali and Ravi Bopara
stories.summary: Moeen Ali produced an abundant one-day innings to raise horizons and rouse spirits, but it will take more than a one-man masterclass, however brilliant, to turn England into fancied World Cup contenders

image.longCaption: Moeen Ali was in fluent touch, Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo, November 26, 2014

image.caption: Ravi Bopara gave England a handy late burst
image.longCaption: Ravi Bopara gave England a handy late burst, England v India, only T20, Edgbaston, September 7, 2014

stories.title: Cook looks to steady England ship
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Alastair Cook looks to steady England ship
stories.summary: In monsoon season, England look to get on course for the World Cup

image.longCaption: Alastair Cook and Alex Hales worked together in the nets but seem unlikely to do so at the start of the ODI series, Colombo, November 24, 2014

stories.title: Struggling sides seek World Cup form
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Struggling sides seek World Cup form
stories.summary: ESPNcricinfo previews the opening ODI in Colombo between Sri Lanka and England, two sides trying to find form and dodge the rain

image.caption: Jeevan Mendis pleads with the umpire
image.longCaption: Jeevan Mendis pleads with the umpire, Kings XI Punjab v Barbados Tridents, Champions League T20, Mohali, September 20, 2014

stories.title: Thirimanne set for middle order role
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
stories.seoTitle: Lahiru Thirimanne set for middle order role
stories.summary: Lahiru Thirimanne, Sri Lanka vice-captain, suggested he would continue to bat in the lower middle order until the World Cup, despite having tasted his greatest successes higher up the order.

image.caption: Lahiru Thirimanne punches on the off side
image.longCaption: Lahiru Thirimanne punches on the off side, India v Sri Lanka, 4th ODI, Kolkata, November 13, 2014

videos.title: Moeen the life and soul of England's party
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
videos.seoTitle: Moeen the life and soul of England's party
videos.summary: Alan Gardner reports from Colombo where Sri Lanka closed out a 25-run win against England in the first ODI despite Moeen Ali's 119.

videos.title: 'We ticked all the boxes' - Mathews
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
videos.summary: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews applauded his team after beating England by 25 runs in the first ODI and said his team 'showed improvement' following the series in India

videos.title: England ready to go - Cook
videos.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, Colombo
videos.summary: England captain Alastair Cook spoke ahead of England's first ODI against Sri Lanka about the recent work that the rest of his side had put in during training and admitted that the entire squad are in shock following Phil Hughes' injury.

videos.title: Are England confusing themselves?
videos.subTitle: Sri Lanka v England, 1st ODI, Colombo
videos.summary: Fidel and Alan look ahead to the first ODI between Sri Lanka and England as Moeen Ali looks set to partner Alastair Cook as an opening batsman while the home side have opening issues themselves
